details.title: FER-2165: Update IDR repository with the same fix
details.author: MihaiBojescuTS

reviews.body:
## Pull request overview

This PR applies a data mapping fix to the IDR (Interval Data Repository) to ensure consistency with a previous fix. The change corrects how demand values are remapped when querying interval data.

**Key Change:**
- Updates the demand field mapping from `demandSumAllMeters` to `demandAvgAcrossMeters` in the IDR interval data repository

details.title: FER-1855: Database connection issues new driver
details.author: MihaiBojescuTS

reviews.body:
## Pull request overview This PR addresses a critical database deadlock issue in the "recent customers" functionality that was causing the connection pool to become exhausted and the API to become unresponsive. The fix replaces the previous transaction-based approach with a single atomic SQL MERGE operation that handles concurrent upserts safely. Additionally, the PR adds comprehensive logging to the SQL Server Query Builder driver to improve observability and debugging capabilities. **Key changes:** - Replaced multi-query transaction logic with a single atomic MERGE statement using table-level locking to prevent deadlocks - Added semicolons to all SQL transaction statements for consistency and best practices - Enhanced logging throughout the SQL Server driver for better debugging and monitoring ### Reviewed changes Copilot reviewed 5 out of 5 changed files in this pull request and generated 2 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | packages/api/src/modules/customers/repositories/recentCustomers.ts | Replaced transaction-based upsert logic with atomic MERGE statement to prevent deadlocks | | packages/api/src/drivers/sqlServerQueryBuilderDriver/transaction.ts | Added semicolons to SQL statements and SET XACT_ABORT ON for automatic rollback on errors | | packages/api/src/drivers/sqlServerQueryBuilderDriver/client.ts | Added debug logging for connection lifecycle and query execution | | packages/api/tests/unit/tests/modules/customers/repositories/recentCustomers.test.ts | Updated tests to verify the new MERGE-based implementation | | packages/api/tests/unit/tests/drivers/sqlServerQueryBuilderDriver/transaction.test.ts | Updated test expectations to include semicolons in SQL statements |
--- ðŸ’¡ Add Copilot custom instructions for smarter, more guided reviews. Learn how to get started.

details.title: FER-2138: Error message is not displayed inside the modal, when saving a report which has an already existing name
details.author: MihaiBojescuTS

reviews.body:
## Pull request overview

This PR fixes a bug where unique constraint violations from SQL Server were not being properly detected, preventing duplicate report name error messages from displaying in the modal. The issue stemmed from checking for the wrong error property (`error.number` vs `error.code`) when detecting SQL Server constraint violations.

**Key changes:**
- Updated error detection logic to check `error.code` instead of `error.number` for SQL Server constraint violations
- Removed the `RequestError` constructor name check to simplify error detection
- Updated corresponding unit tests to mock errors with the `code` property instead of `number`

### Reviewed changes

Copilot reviewed 2 out of 2 changed files in this pull request and generated 1 comment.

| File | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| packages/api/src/modules/customReports/repositories/customReports.ts | Fixed duplicate report detection by checking `error.code` instead of `error.number` and removing `RequestError` constructor check |
| packages/api/tests/unit/tests/modules/customReports/repositories/customReports.test.ts | Updated test mocks to use `Error` with `code` property instead of `RequestError` with `number` property |

reviews.body:
Here i understand that once you extend the granularity, it shoud not have any of the ooptions selected. But when it has the length of one of the values and it is just moved from right to left, shouldnt the value still remain selected? 
Has this a requirement? 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c0dd6c6a-0b83-4853-936a-7fcc4f1378c5

I m doing a comparation between local and dev and i have my doubts on what selecting one day must do and display. I think it should display a range, and it displays only a value. Is this intended?
